LEA.Living Artifact: put a counter on target artifact for each life you lose. during upkeep you may trade one counter for one life but you can only trade in one counter each turn.
LEA.Ancestral Recall: draw 3 cards or force opponent to draw 3 cards.
LEA.Howl from Beyond: target creature gains + x/+0 until end of turn.
LEA.Copy Artifact: select any artifact in play. this enchantment acts as a duplicate of that artifact; enchantment copy is affected by cards that affect either enchantments or artifacts. enchantment copy remains even if original artifact is destroyed.
LEA.Wrath of God: all creatures in play are destroyed and cannot regenerate.
LEA.Pirate Ship: tap to do 1 damage to any target. cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play though controller may still tap. this is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.
LEA.Jade Statue: can be a creature only during an attack or defense.
LEA.Time Vault: tap to gain an additional turn after the current one. this doesn't untap normally during untap phase; to untap it you must skip a turn. this begins tapped.
LEA.Animate Dead: any creature in either player's graveyard comes into play on your side with -1 to its original power. if this enchantment is removed or at end of game target creature is returned to its owner's graveyard. target creature may be killed as normal.
LEA.Blue Elemental Blast: counters a red spell being cast or destroys a red card in play.
LEA.Flight: target creature is now a flying creature.
LEA.Contract from Below: discard your current hand and draw eight new cards adding the first drawn to your ante. remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.
LEA.Ivory Cup: any white spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.
LEA.Word of Command: you may look at opponent's hand and choose any card opponent can legally play using mana from his or her mana pool or lands. opponent must play this card immediately; you make all the decisions it calls for. this spell may not be countered after you have looked at opponent's hand.
LEA.Lich: you lose all life. if you gain life later in the game instead draw one card from your library for each life. for each point of damage you suffer you must destroy one of your cards in play. creatures destroyed in this way cannot be regenerated. you lose if this enchantment is destroyed or if you suffer a point of damage without sending a card to the graveyard.
LEA.Power Leak: target enchantment costs 2 extra mana each turn during upkeep. if target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana this does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.
LEA.Mox Emerald: add 1 green mana to your mana pool. tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.
LEA.Northern Paladin: destroys a black card in play. cannot be used to cancel a black spell as it is being cast.
LEA.Kudzu: when target land is tapped it is destroyed. unless that was the last land in play this is not discarded; instead the player whose land it just destroyed may place it on another land of his or her choice.
LEA.Creature Bond: if target creature is destroyed this does an amount of damage equal to creature's toughness to creature's controller.
LEA.Tsunami: all islands in play are destroyed.
LEA.Lifetap: you gain 1 life each time any forest of opponent's becomes tapped.
LEA.Living Lands: treat all forests in play as 1/1 creatures. now they can be enchanted killed and so forth and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. the living lands have no color; they are not considered green cards.
LEA.Scrubland: counts as both plains and swamp and is affected by spells that affect either. tap to add either or to your mana pool.
LEA.Demonic Hordes: tap to destroy 1 land. pay during upkeep or the hordes become tapped and you lose a land of opponent's choice.
LEA.Red Ward: target creature gains protection from red.
LEA.Armageddon: all lands in play are destroyed.
LEA.Time Walk: take an extra turn after this one.
LEA.Underground Sea: counts as both swamp and islands and is affected by spells that affect either. tap to add either or to your mana pool.
LEA.Sacrifice: destroy one of your creatures without regenerating it and add to your mana pool a number of black mana equal to black creature's casting cost.

3ED.Simulacrum: all damage done to you so far this turn is instead retroactively applied to one of your creatures in play. even if there's more than enough damage to kill the creature you don't suffer any of it. further damage this turn is treated normally.
3ED.Conversion: all mountains are considered basic plains while this is in play. pay during upkeep or this is discarded.

3ED.Drain Power: opponent must draw all mana from his or her available lands; this mana and all mana in opponent's mana pool drains into your mana pool. you can't take less than all your opponent's mana.

3ED.Juggernaut: must attack each turn if possible. can't be blocked by walls.

LEB.Simulacrum: all damage done to you so far this turn is instead retroactively applied to one of your creatures in play. if this damage kills the creature it can be regenerated; even if there's more than enough damage to kill the creature you don't suffer any of it. further damage this turn is treated normally.
LEB.Conversion: all mountains are considered plains while this is in play. pay during upkeep or this is discarded.
LEB.Sleight of Mind: change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one color word with another. for example you can change " counters red spells" to " counters black spells." cannot change mana symbols.
LEB.Drain Power: tap all opponent's land taking all this mana and all mana in opponent's mana pool into your mana pool. you can't tap fewer than all opponent's lands.
LEB.Regrowth: return any card from your graveyard to your hand.
LEB.Web: target creature gains +0/+2 and can now block flying creatures though it does not gain the power to fly.
LEB.Weakness: target creature loses -2/-1; if this drops the creature's toughness below 1 it is dead.
LEB.Cockatrice: flying any non-wall creature blocking this is destroyed as is any creature blocked by this. creatures destroyed in this way deal their damage before dying.
LEB.Wooden Sphere: any green spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.
LEB.Instill Energy: you may untap target creature both during your untap phase and one additional time during your turn. target creature may attack the turn it comes into play.
LEB.Juggernaut: must attack each turn if possible. can't be blocked by walls.
LEB.Samite Healer: tap to prevent 1 damage to any target.
LEB.Darkpact: without looking at it first swap top card of your library with either card of the ante; this swap is permanent. you must have a card in your library to cast this spell. remove this card from your deck before playing if you are not playing for ante.
LEB.Goblin King: goblins in play gain mountainwalk and +1/+1 while this card remains in play.
LEB.Helm of Chatzuk: you may give one creature the ability to band until end of turn.
LEB.Cyclopean Tomb: turn any one non-swamp land into swamp during upkeep. mark the changed lands with tokens. if this is destroyed remove one token of your choice each upkeep returning that land to its original nature.
LEB.Rock Hydra: put x +1/+1 counters on hydra. each point of damage hydra suffers destroys one head unless is spent. during upkeep new heads may be grown for apiece.
LEB.Righteousness: target defending creature gains +7/+7 until end of turn.
LEB.Lifelace: changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to green. cost to cast tap maintain or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.
LEB.Purelace: changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to white. cost to cast tap maintain or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

ARN.Shahrazad: players must leave game in progress as it is and use the cards left in their libraries as decks with which to play a subgame of magic. when subgame is over players shuffle these cards return them to libraries and resume game in progress with any loser of subgame halving his or her remaining life points rounding down. effects that prevent damage may not be used to counter this loss of life. the subgame has no ante; using less than forty cards may be necessary.
